column5: awesome!!Congrats...get a nice pic blown up with the lure attached to it.. Hard to beat 45lb laker!
Gargantuan laker.  Congrats on an amazing catch, and, good luck with the replica mount!!
Come on, tell us...you pee'd a little right?  Beauty laker!

A true Giant, congradulations on a memory of a lifetime, a replica would be sweet, if it comes to be post a pic of the rep as well, I am sure you have lots of great pictures, so you have all the time in the world to butter up to your wife for a replica.  Start by taking her to the Keg for a steak and wine dinner, that usually softens them up, at least it works for me
Absolute tank Anders, perhaps you'll never best it, but my wish to you is you spend a great deal of time trying and hopefully someday succeeding!
Type,model,size ,color please.Whether I use it or not in the next little while.I want one!!! Congrats,beautiful fish.
Awesome fish anders!! Id clip that lure to the pic, or mount, that im sure you plan on getting done. Congratulations!
Now that is an awesome laker!!!  Congrats on your PB (Personal BEAST)  Love to see those big fish.
nice fish  a true tank there
Insane Laker!! Congrats and thanks for sharing. Hope you get a bigger one someday. You gotta love the North of Superior (and Superior) areas if you're a fisherman.
Now that's a GIANT Laker, fish of a life time. Congrats Anders.   Love to see that mount.
Anders  Wow!  That is a "Laker"  Rick
Congrats on a beauty of a fish!! A true giant!
thanks for all the nice words everyone, and yes spiel, the plan is to annually try to best that, but it may take a while, but it will be enjoyable to try.
Thats is one big ugly grease pig!!         Looks like a silver streak to me...
Beautious! Congrats on the fish that was worth the wait.

I recently went on a fishing trip that i have dreamed of for years and the fishing was great but the trophy was nothing what i expected.  I was thinking of fish in the 20lbs class but not this.  this fish took about 30-35 min to bring in, a fight that was pretty much a stand still for a good 25 min of it, on 14 lb test line, fishing off a rigger 71 ft down.  truly a trophy and a relic.  My father in law took this pic of me half way through the tug of war   Here it is 44 long x 29 wide   Another   And the result of the hook during the battle.  This spoon is officially retired
Congrats! What a beast of  a fish
Right on----Is that a Nipigon Laker??
That is one beast of a laker! Congrats!
fat fish!
Beauty Fish. That things is a beast.

WOW!!!!!   I absolutely love this post....well done sir!!!!  Online lake trout calculator puts that beast at 46 pounds!!!!   http://www.laketrout.org/lake-trout-weight-calculator.htm  Definitely clip that spoon to the boat in a special spot...love the hook damage.  Congrats on a gorgeous fish....can't get over how massive that gut is.
What a beast!  Congrats!  I may get me one of those spoons now...
Sweet fish!!!
Beauty ... but there just has to be a bigger one out there.
whohoooo !!! Congrats on a Beeeuteee !!! Laker
I love me some giant lakers!   Most likely not, hooks still have barbs on them (Lake Nipigon is completely barbless)
Well done, great fish!
I really have to get one of those one day. Awesome beast of a fish it is!!!
Yer gonna need a bigger boat......   .......and lure, for the next one!
very nice!
Awesome fish anders!! Id clip that lure to the pic, or mount, that im sure you plan on getting done. Congratulations!
Beast! I would stick that hook and spoon on the side of the picture I'd have on the wall.
Very nice fish!
Wow, what a beast, big congrats to you!!! Great report, love the bent hook pics.
Sweet looking laker. Is that an N/K or Silver Fox spoon?

thanks guys.  I got that out on Lake Superior this past weekend.  i have been reliving it every day since.  i already have an 8x10 done and am working on my wife for a replica.  whatever i get that spoon is going with either the picture or the replica.  on the water i said it was damn near 50 but after a few beer and disussions around dinner in the 40's for sure, father in law said 45
Wow, what a catch!
Wow! Yes, a catch of a lifetime. No need to go to Great Bear Lake in NWT.
